{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3495116,"name":"Thomas Coen","username":"Tommy5104","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tommy5104/{size}/252252_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-28T21:58:14.175Z","cooked":"

Our team is most likely going to be doing a pivot this year without a rack and pinion system. In the past when we have tried this we have struggled with backlash. What are some ways to reduce backlash on our pivot?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":5,"updated_at":"2025-01-28T21:58:14.175Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":35,"reads":175,"readers_count":174,"score":210.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":484033,"topic_slug":"how-to-reduce-backlash-on-a-pivot","display_username":"Thomas Coen","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":64130,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/how-to-reduce-backlash-on-a-pivot/484033/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":3495123,"name":"John Hascall (he)","username":"john3928","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/john3928/{size}/143275_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-28T22:04:44.720Z","cooked":"

First step would be to identify the source(s) of backlash. This thread may be helpful Hex shaft backlash / sloppiness

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":5,"updated_at":"2025-01-28T22:04:44.720Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":5,"reads":166,"readers_count":165,"score":73.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":484033,"topic_slug":"how-to-reduce-backlash-on-a-pivot","display_username":"John Hascall (he)","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/hex-shaft-backlash-sloppiness/483792","internal":true,"reflection":false,"title":"Hex shaft backlash / sloppiness","clicks":47}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":46267,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Opinions expressed are mine only"},"post_url":"/t/how-to-reduce-backlash-on-a-pivot/484033/2","custom_user_title":"Opinions expressed are mine only","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":true,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3495143,"name":"Skye Leake","username":"Skyehawk","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/skyehawk/{size}/179363_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-28T22:21:59.159Z","cooked":"

  • See the hex bore thread John linked

  • Proper easily adjustable tensioners

  • Use large sprockets/pulleys

  • Design mechanisms to not need setpoints where backlash is at its worse

  • Use appropriate pitch belts/chains/gearing for your application

  • Preload a certain direction

  • Complient mechanisms/living hinges can be quite powerful

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":5,"updated_at":"2025-01-28T22:22:13.833Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":140,"readers_count":139,"score":93.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":484033,"topic_slug":"how-to-reduce-backlash-on-a-pivot","display_username":"Skye Leake","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":4}],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":19235,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Pretengineer"},"post_url":"/t/how-to-reduce-backlash-on-a-pivot/484033/3","custom_user_title":"Pretengineer","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":4}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":4,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3495149,"name":"Chris Gerth","username":"gerthworm","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/gerthworm/{size}/268658_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-28T22:32:25.939Z","cooked":"
Skyehawk:

Preload a certain direction

Came here to say this.

In a pinch, just running the pivot on “one side” of the backlash at all times will get you far. Running the motor at ~10% power open loop for a short period of time can be done to “take up” the backlash before reverting to closed loop control in certain cases.

But, to be clear, this is a band-aid on a band-aid on a band-aid. It’s still week 3 (right?), might wanna try another solution first.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":5,"updated_at":"2025-01-28T22:32:25.939Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":107,"readers_count":106,"score":46.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":484033,"topic_slug":"how-to-reduce-backlash-on-a-pivot","display_username":"Chris Gerth","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":24617,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/how-to-reduce-backlash-on-a-pivot/484033/4","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3495152,"name":"","username":"Alex_Y","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/82dd89/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-28T22:35:44.386Z","cooked":"

Eliminate hex shaft wherever possible. Hex/hex interfaces are incredibly bad in terms of backlash, but the problematic interactions can be avoided in a deadaxle or zombie axle setup in which the sprocket and arm act as 1 solid rigid piece. Unavoidable hexes can be shimmed for some improvement, but it’s not as good as just eliminating the hex.

gerthworm:

But, to be clear, this is a band-aid on a band-aid on a band-aid. It’s still week 3 (right?), might wanna try another solution first.

It’s an extremely bandaid solution as in many cases, inertia wins and it will still move around. Yes it will eventually settle, but that is wasting a bunch of time which is the primary problem with excessive backlash in the first place.
